channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Wildlife crossings save animals, people and billions in vehicular damage costs
item.description: Car crashes with wildlife kill about 200 Americans every year. Federal funding is helping states build safe animal crossings to reduce the carnage.
item.content:encoded: Car crashes with wildlife kill about 200 Americans every year. Federal funding is helping states build safe animal crossings to reduce the carnage.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Daniel

item.title: When ice and snow build up on the roads, this woman heads out for a drive
item.description: Driving a snowplow isn't for everyone. It means long hours driving a tank-like truck, and always in weather that would keep many folks at home. We take a ride with a young woman who loves her job.
item.content:encoded: Driving a snowplow isn't for everyone. It means long hours driving a tank-like truck, and always in weather that would keep many folks at home. We take a ride with a young woman who loves her job.
item.dc:creator: Emily Russell

item.title: The Navy is struggling to build ships
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Cynthia Cook from the Center for International and Strategic Studies about why naval shipbuilding in the U.S. has become so difficult lately.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Cynthia Cook from the Center for International and Strategic Studies about why naval shipbuilding in the U.S. has become so difficult lately.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Midair collision involving 2 helicopters in New Jersey leaves 1 dead, 1 injured
item.description: A midair collision involving two helicopters in Hammonton, New Jersey, killed one person and critically injured another, federal authorities say.
item.content:encoded: A midair collision involving two helicopters in Hammonton, New Jersey, killed one person and critically injured another, federal authorities say.
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Many farmers are going into 2026 on the brink
item.description: President Trump says 2026 will be better for American farmers, thanks in part to $12 billion in new federal "bridge payments." But optimism remains hard to come by in farm country.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says 2026 will be better for American farmers, thanks in part to $12 billion in new federal "bridge payments." But optimism remains hard to come by in farm country.

(Image credit: Kirk Siegler)
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: New report reveals the role of U.S. jets in global drug trafficking
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks investigative journalist Jonny Wrate about the role of U.S. jets in global drug trafficking, in light of a new report by the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks investigative journalist Jonny Wrate about the role of U.S. jets in global drug trafficking, in light of a new report by the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: For those who help the poor, 2025 goes down as a year of chaos
item.description: Local anti-poverty groups have had to scramble and scale back this year as the Trump administration targeted safety-net programs. They are bracing for what may come next.
item.content:encoded:
Local anti-poverty groups have had to scramble and scale back this year as the Trump administration targeted safety-net programs. They are bracing for what may come next.

(Image credit: Rich-Joseph Facun for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: D.C. mayor and police chief step aside after backlash over Trump's crime crackdown
item.description: Washington, D.C.'s mayor and police chief are calling it quits after their handling of President Trump's immigration crackdown was criticized.
item.content:encoded: Washington, D.C.'s mayor and police chief are calling it quits after their handling of President Trump's immigration crackdown was criticized.
item.dc:creator: Alex Koma

item.title: Pipe bomb suspect told FBI he targeted U.S. political parties, memo says
item.description: The man accused of placing two pipe bombs in Washington on the eve of Jan. 6, 2021 told investigators someone needed to "speak up" for people who believed the 2020 election was stolen, prosecutors said Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
The man accused of placing two pipe bombs in Washington on the eve of Jan. 6, 2021 told investigators someone needed to "speak up" for people who believed the 2020 election was stolen, prosecutors said Sunday.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Heavy snow, strong winds and extreme chill sweep from the Midwest to the East Coast
item.description: A "bomb cyclone" is intensifying severe winter weather for millions of people across the U.S. The system is expected to knock out power and disrupt holiday travel.
item.content:encoded:
A "bomb cyclone" is intensifying severe winter weather for millions of people across the U.S. The system is expected to knock out power and disrupt holiday travel.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
